thread.title: Results Day 2015: What have students been saying?
thread.title_full: Results Day 2015: What have students been saying? - Telegraph

author: Samuel Lovett and James Connington
title: Results Day 2015: What have students been saying?
text: With A-level Results Day upon us, students from across the country have taken to Twitter to voice their opinions. From the dramatic to the comedic, students have been using everything from Harry Potter to Simon Cowell to express how they’re feeling in the build up to the big day. We take you through some of the best #ResultsDay tweets from across the UK. Some got straight to the point... I've never been so scared in my life.. #resultsday — V??pi?? ? (@Dannvyy) August 10, 2015 Literally feel so sick I've never been more terrified to open an envelope before #LeavingCert #resultsday — Kayleigh Keogh (@keogh_kayleigh) August 12, 2015 And even predicted the end... My life will either begin or end tomorrow #resultsday — Grace (@graaaceeeey) August 12, 2015 This could be the last day of happiness for me, depending on how tomorrow morning goes #ResultsDay — *Bethaaan* (@bethanjones1996) August 12, 2015 But others were stranglely subdued... Ah well sure whatever happens now happens #resultsday — Emer Slye (@EmerSlye1) August 12, 2015 And took the profound and philosophical approach... Grades dont define a person, integrity does ;) #LeavingCert #resultsday #thoughtoftheday — My Success Mind (@mysuccessmind) August 12, 2015 One individual seemed to be confusing their nerves for hunger... Idk if I'm nervous or just really hungry #resultsday — Gabby ? (@gabriellaxmay) August 12, 2015 While others stopped making sense... Bl gg #resultsday — Immy Hailstone (@_immyrose) August 12, 2015 Naturally, some were excited for the big day... Weirdly I'm now excited for results day #bringiton — Clementina Allende (@Clementeenie) August 12, 2015 And were already looking beyond their results... I would be dreading results day but I'm too excited to go out after ! — abs (@absfollowill) August 12, 2015 Or weren't even thinking about them... For breakfast tomorrow I shall be drinking an entire bottle of pimms #resultsday — Justallen (@annabelcowell) August 12, 2015 Even so, some turned to politics for their #ResultsDayExcuse... #resultsdayexcuses i was too emotional over Miliband's resignation — tarin (@_tarin11) August 10, 2015 While others tried to blamed their muggle-born examiners... #ResultsDayExcuses The muggle examiner marked my correct answer wrong pic.twitter.com/mfiBjHXFnV — Hogwarts Logic (@HogwartsLogic) August 12, 2015 As for one individual, he took a noble sacrifice for the 'squad'... #ResultsDayExcuses I flopped on purpose to lower grade boundaries for the squad — GCSE Problems (@GCSEProbIems) August 12, 2015 Others conveyed their emotion through music... #resultsdayplaylist ‘when you try your best but you don’t succeed’ — cxitt (@cxtt_wxlker) August 4, 2015 #resultsdayplaylist Hit me baby one more time, Feat Mum — Rathikk (@rathikk99) August 4, 2015 Talking of music, here's what Simon Cowell had to say... when unis see my results #resultsday pic.twitter.com/JImywRjfTS — emma (@stxy_awake) August 12, 2015 But, thankfully, others were far more thoughtful... Good luck to everyone getting their results tomorrow. Massive believer in what's meant to be will be #resultsday — sarah (@sarah_farrell96) August 12, 2015 I hope everyone gets the grades they want tomorrow, if not there are plenty of other options. Good luck #resultsday — Luccccie (@Letlucie) August 12, 2015 We couldn't agree more...good luck everyone!
